Class TileShell

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.AbstractButton
javax.swing.JButton
view.TileShell
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class TileShell
extends javax.swing.JButton
The shell of a tile, including the ability to click to place a piece there.
See Also:

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    TileShell​(Tile piece, int width, java.awt.Color backgroundColor, java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<Message> messageQueue)
    Constructs the shell of this given Tile with the given background color.
    TileShell​(Tile piece, int width, java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<Message> messageQueue)
    Constructs the shell of this given Tile with a default forest green background color (the normal color of a Reversi board).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void disableTile()
    Disable this tile so that it is no longer clickable and sets the background color to a forest green color.
    void enableTile()
    Enable this tile to be clicked, and changes the background color to be red to indicate that this is a legal position to place a piece.
    void fastFlip()
    Flip this piece with no animation.
    void flip()
    Flip this piece with an animation (this takes about .5 seconds)
    void placePiece​(Tile piece)
    Place a piece on this tile (may be empty, which will clear the tile).

  • Constructor Details

    • TileShell

      public TileShell​(Tile piece, int width, java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<Message> messageQueue)
      Constructs the shell of this given Tile with a default forest green background color (the normal color of a Reversi board).
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece occupying this tile (may be empty).
      width - The width of the tile shell.
      messageQueue - The queue to place the button clicked message in.

    • TileShell

      public TileShell​(Tile piece, int width, java.awt.Color backgroundColor, java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<Message> messageQueue)
      Constructs the shell of this given Tile with the given background color.
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece occupying this tile (may be empty).
      width - The width of the tile shell.
      backgroundColor - The background color of the tile.
      messageQueue - The queue to place the button clicked message in.

  • Method Details

    • placePiece

      public void placePiece​(Tile piece)
      Place a piece on this tile (may be empty, which will clear the tile).
      Parameters:
      piece - The piece to place.

    • flip

      public void flip()
      Flip this piece with an animation (this takes about .5 seconds)

    • fastFlip

      public void fastFlip()
      Flip this piece with no animation.

    • enableTile

      public void enableTile()
      Enable this tile to be clicked, and changes the background color to be red to indicate that this is a legal position to place a piece.

    • disableTile

      public void disableTile()
      Disable this tile so that it is no longer clickable and sets the background color to a forest green color.
